intro: Andreettaea sibatensis, commonly known as the Sibatense Andreettaea, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
